description.strong: I know what I want to buy. I compare and I choose. I stretch dollars.
description.br: I track the best prices I find for the items I buy regularly. If I want help to compare prices, I input size and unit of measure for an item to see the price per unit. To understand the value of a small bottle as compared to a large bottle of juice, I can input the size and price of each, and then see and compare the price per ounce. For example, the 12 oz bottle is priced at $2.40, and the gallon is $6.40. I see that the 12 oz bottle costs $.20/per oz, while the gallon is only $.10/per oz. If my people drink a lot of orange juice, buying gallons will really stretch my dollars!
